intro: Myosotis pygmaea var. drucei, commonly known as the dwarf forget-me-not, is a small flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
